alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 9:13AM EDT until July 11 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... Neuse River Near Clayton affecting Johnston County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neuse River Near Clayton. * WHEN...From this morning to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Minor overflow occurs on both banks. Water reaches the edge of the Neuse River Greenway trail. At 10.0 feet, Upstream of the gage site, the Neuse River Greenway at Covered Bridge Road begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 9.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 AM EDT Sunday was 9.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.3 feet on 10/12/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 am EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Thu Neuse River Clayton 9.0 9.2 Sun 8 am EDT 3.0 2.0 2.0 1.9 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued this evening by 915 PM EDT.
